actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

actions.subcommittee: Regulatory Reform, Commercial And Antitrust Law
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Regulatory Reform, Commercial And Antitrust Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Regulatory Reform, Commercial And Antitrust Law

official_title: To make the antitrust laws applicable to a political committee under the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 which is established and administered by a separate segregated fund of a corporation pursuant to section 316(b)(2)(C) of such Act.

summary.text: Applies the antitrust laws to a political committee under the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 which is established and administered by a separate segregated fund of a corporation. Prohibits any such political committee for multiple legal entities in the same business.

titles.title: To make the antitrust laws applicable to a political committee under the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 which is established and administered by a separate segregated fund of a corporation pursuant to section 316(b)(2)(C) of such Act.
